decks.notes: The deck aims to quickly assemble the "storm" combo by casting multiple spells in a single turn, generating mana with Rituals and Medallion, digging through the deck with cantrips like Serum Visions and Preordain, and eventually hitting critical mass with Past in Flames to re-cast spells from the graveyard. Ral, Monsoon Mage provides additional card advantage and control, while Wish allows for toolbox options. Grapeshot is the primary win condition, dealing damage to the opponent based on the number of spells cast in that turn.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It also utilizes powerful win conditions like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly close out the game once control has been established. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse range of spells in the deck and ensure consistency in casting the key cards. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and grind out incremental advantages until victory is secured.

The main concept of this deck is to have a fast-paced aggressive strategy while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude while also applying pressure with powerful threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also utilizes synergy between cards like Ephemerate and Witch Enchanter to gain advantage and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan while also providing necessary color options for the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while drawing cards and generating value. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional benefits to the deck's creatures. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck while also providing flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing powerful threats like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support from cards like Wild Nacatl and Tribal Flames, the deck looks to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Stubborn Denial provides protection while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding offer additional synergies with the deck's strategy. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of color requirements, allowing for maximum flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to swarm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful synergies in order to quickly overwhelm them and deal massive amounts of damage. Key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide strong threats, while cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer help maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent or clear the way for a final attack. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm provide disruption and protection for your creatures.

This deck aims to quickly generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and Goblin Charbelcher, utilizing cards like Valakut Awakening and Glimpse the Impossible for card advantage. The combination of rituals and mana generators allows for explosive plays without the need for traditional lands, making it difficult for opponents to disrupt the strategy. Pinnacle Monk and Stormscale Scion provide additional threats to pressure the opponent while the deck assembles its combo pieces for a devastating finish.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp quickly and efficiently using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to get out powerful lands such as Urza's Saga and Gruul Turf. Once these lands are in play, the deck aims to abuse the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to generate massive amounts of mana and quickly win the game through cards like Scapeshift or Cultivator Colossus. The inclusion of utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tolaria West also help to further the combo and protect against disruption from opponents.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End, using cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple. It also utilizes artifacts and enchantments like Blade of the Bloodchief and Vexing Bauble to generate value and control the board. The deck includes a combination of creature threats and disruptive elements to create a versatile gameplay experience. With a mix of fast creatures and resilient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its synergistic combo interactions.

This deck focuses on using ramp and control elements to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker. Sowing Mycospawn helps ramp up mana, while cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command provide control against opposing threats. Writhing Chrysalis can be used to stall or create additional blockers. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Cavern of Souls to support the Eldrazi strategy. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large Eldrazi threats while maintaining control of the game.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble. The deck can quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the battlefield. Additionally, it has a toolbox of diverse creatures and spells to handle different threats, ensuring that it can adapt to various situations and outlast the opponent in the long game.

This deck aims to assemble the combo of Jeskai Ascendancy with several low-cost artifacts and miscellaneous spells to generate a loop of untapping and tapping Emry, Lurker of the Loch and other permanents, allowing for card draw, mana production, and eventually a win condition. It leverages the power of efficient cantrips and mana rocks, alongside disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Flame of Anor, to create a versatile and resilient strategy that can outmaneuver opponent's game plans while racing towards a decisive victory.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent, then quickly casting Living End to bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Curator of Mysteries and Subtlety to control the board and protect the combo. The mix of creatures, counter spells, and disruption ensures that the deck has multiple ways to win and can adapt to different matchups. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and win in a single explosive turn.

The main idea of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly amass a board presence with low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration are used for card advantage and selection, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide additional damage output. The mana base focuses on fetching/filtering through lands like Arid Mesa and Scalding Tarn. The deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and efficient in dealing damage to the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Amulet of Vigor, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, in order to quickly cast Primeval Titan and search for key lands like Urza's Saga. This deck utilizes combo pieces like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to quickly assemble a win condition, while also benefiting from the land synergies of Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf. With strong ramping capabilities and powerful combo potential, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays.

The main goal of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to play Primeval Titan and search for combo pieces. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts like Amulet of Vigor and Lotus Field. The combo finish involves using cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact while also setting up for explosive combo turns.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with abilities that synergize well with each other, such as Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes removal options like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to maintain board control. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer helps to provide card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck looks to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and removal options.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Broodscale creature cards and the Blade of the Bloodchief equipment to create a powerful combo. By playing cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker alongside support cards like Walking Ballista and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End adds a powerful finisher to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces with lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple providing additional value.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between cards such as Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Walking Ballista to create a powerful combo. By using cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and generate value, the deck aims to set up a win condition with Emrakul, the Promised End or Blade of the Bloodchief. With support from cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, the deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence and strategic plays.

The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures, using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Linebreaker to disrupt their strategy while dealing damage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to control the board and maintain pressure. The mana base is optimized to support the Eldrazi creatures, with a focus on colorless sources like Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls. Overall, the deck's strategy is to establish a powerful board presence and outpace the opponent's threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures and ramping up to powerful threats quickly. The key strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble, while also ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans. The deck aims to drop hard-hitting threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker ahead of schedule to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption options, ensuring a versatile and resilient gameplay experience.

Ramp up mana quickly using mana ramp spells and lands to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures, controlling the board with removal spells and disruption until you can summon Emrakul, the Promised End for a game-winning threat. Utilize synergy between Eldrazi creatures and spells to overwhelm opponents and dominate the game through a combination of potent threats, resource denial, and efficient control elements.

This deck focuses on using Jeskai Ascendancy to create a powerful combo that allows for multiple activations of powerful abilities. By using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and mana ramp, the deck can quickly assemble the necessary pieces to go off. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Narset, Jeskai Waymaster provide additional value and digging power, while cards like Repeal and Metallic Rebuke offer disruption and protection. The deck contains a mix of artifacts, creatures, and spells to create a versatile and adaptive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to create a powerful combo that allows for multiple spells to be cast in a single turn, generating a lot of value and potentially overwhelming the opponent. It includes synergy between cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to cycle through the deck quickly and set up the combo. The deck also features disruption with cards like Portable Hole and Repeal, as well as proactive threats like Narset, Jeskai Waymaster and Cori-Steel Cutter.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using creatures, artifacts, and instant spells to control the game without relying on traditional lands. The strategy involves using cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Hydroelectric Specimen to generate mana, while Tameshi, Reality Architect and Thundertrap Trainer provide additional support. The win condition is typically achieved through Goblin Charbelcher's ability to deal damage directly to the opponent. The deck also includes control elements like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own.

This deck focuses on utilizing the odd converted mana cost cards to take full advantage of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion. The deck is centered around aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Solitude, and Ketramose, the New Dawn to put pressure on opponents. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm and outpace opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent and maintaining a fast tempo throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Expressive Iteration and Slickshot Show-Off help with card advantage and filtering through the deck for key pieces. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board and deal damage to the opponent by utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, Slickshot Show-Off, and Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck also includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to further pressure the opponent. Mishra's Bauble allows for card draw and manipulation, while cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide combat tricks and additional damage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for a fast and deadly aggro strategy.

This UR aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to quickly get ahead on board. Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter help to keep the pressure on while Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage. Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt serve as efficient removal and direct damage, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge allow for combat tricks and extra damage. The deck also includes card selection and mana fixing with Expressive Iteration and Preordain, along with a solid mana base to support the aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to use cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, along with cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth, to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes card draw/filtering with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to maintain card advantage and find the necessary pieces to keep the pressure on. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent casting of spells and maximize aggression.
